meanings.definition: A small piece of food, especially a hard piece of bread or meat.
meanings.sent1: I found a chank of bread in my lunchbox.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a chank of meat to the stew.
meanings.sent3: The chank of bread rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The chank of meat in the sandwich was tough to chew.
meanings.sent5: She packed a chank of cheese for her snack.

meanings.sent1: He tried to chank the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer chanked his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She chanked the ball so hard it flew over the fence.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm chanked the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith chanked the metal to shape it.

meanings.sent1: The chank of the bell echoed through the church.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud chank coming from the metal workshop.
meanings.sent3: The chank of the phone woke me up in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: The chank of the glass shattering startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chank of the doorbell signaled the arrival of the guests.
